description: Aciclovir prescribed at a dose of 250mg/m2 instead of 500mg/m2 for herpes simplex encephalitis in patients aged between 3 months and 12 years (subtherapeutic dose / treatment failure)
Ceftriaxone prescribed at a total daily dose of 50mg/kg instead of 80mg/kg for severe infection /sepsis in a patient >1 month of age  (subtheraputic dose / treatment failure) -
Quinolone, cephalosporin or clindamycin prescribed for a patient older than 60 years; except under the direction of microbiology (risk of Clostridium difficile infection) Median scores:
Prasugrel dose > 5mg prescribed for a patient < 60kg or older than 75 years (increased risk of bleeding)
Low molecular weight heparin prescribed for a patient with low platelet count (may cause or exacerbate thrombocytopenia)
Low molecular weight heparin prescribed for a patient with renal impairment without dose adjustment (increased risk of bleeding)
Teicoplanin prescribed for more than 7 days without indication of levels having been taken (risk of subtherapeutic or excessive treatment)
Vancomycin prescribed for a patient for more than 4 doses without levels having been taken (risk of subtherapeutic or excessive treatment)

Aldosterone antagonists (Spironolactone or eplerenone) prescribed concomitantly with potassium conserving drugs (e.g., ACEI's, ARB's, amiloride, triamterene) for a patient with hyperkalaemia (serum potassium > 5 mmol/litre) (risk of exacerbation of hyperkalaemia)
Beta-adrenoreceptor blocking drugs prescribed concomitantly with verapamil or diltiazem (increased risk of side effects / risk of conduction disorders)
Carbapenem prescribed concomitantly with valproic acid (reduced plasma valproate levels; increased risk of seizures)
Citalopram or escitalopram prescribed concomitantly with other QT prolonging drugs (increased risk of arrhythmias)
Dabigatran dose not reduced when prescribed concomitantly with verapamil (increased risk of bleeding)
Digoxin prescribed concomitantly with a diuretic (risk of hypokalaemia and subsequent digoxin toxicity)
Domperidone prescribed concomitantly with drugs that prolong the QT interval (except in palliative care) (increased risk of arrhythmias)
Macrolide antibacterial prescribed concomitantly with warfarin without appropriate dose adjustment or increased INR monitoring (increased risk of bleeding)
Macrolide prescribed concomitantly with simvastatin 40mg or above (increased risk of myopathy)
Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs prescribed concomitantly with oral anticoagulants (increased risk of bleeding)

Potassium-sparing diuretic (excluding aldosterone antagonists) prescribed concomitantly with angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor or angiotensin II receptor antagonist (increased risk of severe hyperkalaemia)

Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor  prescribed concomitantly with aspirin without appropriate prophylaxis with antisecretory drugs or mucosal protectant (increased risk of gastrointestinal bleeding)
Antimicrobial prescribed for inappropriate duration / without documented review (increased risk of resistant infection, C difficile or other drug toxicity)
Antimicrobial prescribed without a specified indication (increased risk of resistant infection, C difficile or other drug toxicity)
Anti-muscarinic bronchodilators prescribed for a patient with a history of narrow angle glaucoma (may exacerbate glaucoma)
Antiplatelet medication prescribed to a patient with a concurrent bleeding disorder (increased risk of bleeding)
Antipsychotic (other than risperidone) prescribed to a patient for the management of the behavioural and psychological symptoms of dementia (increased risk of stroke)
Any medication prescribed for a patient with a documented allergy to the medication (risk of severe adverse drug reaction)
Aspirin prescribed to a patient with a past medical history of peptic ulcer disease without antisecretory drugs or mucosal protectants (increased risk of peptic ulceration and risk of bleeding)
Dabigatran prescribed for a patient with a mechanical heart valve (increased risk of stroke / bleeding)
Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug prescribed for a patient with a history of heart failure (risk of exacerbation of heart failure)

Penicillin containing compound prescribed to a penicillin allergic patient without reasoning (such as mild or non-allergy entered as an allergy and the indication for penicillin is compelling) (risk of severe adverse drug reaction)
Selective serotonin re-uptake inhibitors prescribed for a patient with epilepsy (reduced seizure threshold)
Warfarin prescribed for a patient with a concurrent bleeding disorder (increased risk of bleeding)
Live vaccine prescribed for an immunosuppressed patient; including  patients prescribed corticosteroids. (risk of serious infection)
Valproate prescribed for a woman of child bearing age (increased risk of foetal abnormalities)
Insulin prescribed for a patient at an inappropriate time, allowing for an administration without food; except once daily long acting insulins (increased risk of hypoglycaemia) -
Intravenous gentamicin dose calculated based on actual body weight rather than ideal body weight in an obese patient (BMI > 30kg/m² ) (increased risk of toxicity)
Low-molecular-weight heparin prescribed without the patient's weight being used to calculate the treatment dose (risk of subtherapeutic or supratherapeutic dosing)
Methotrexate (oral or subcutaneous) prescribed for a patient with an inappropriate frequency (increased risk of toxicity)
Potassium chloride supplements continued for longer than is required (reference range 3.5–5.3 mmol/l) (increased risk of hyperkalaemia)
Paracetamol prescribed at a dose of 4g over a 24 hour period for a patient that weighs 50kg or less (increased risk of overdose)
Apixaban prescribed at a dose of 10mg twice daily for treatment of DVT or PE for more than 7 days (increased risk of bleeding)
Two or more drugs with antimuscarinic/anticholinergic properties concomitantly prescribed (increased risk of side effects)
Two concomitant opiate analgesics that are not in line with the WHO pain ladder (increased adverse effects of opiates)
Amphotericin B prescribed without stating the brand name and the dose in milligrams per kilogram (risk of overdose due to confusion between lipid-based and nonlipid formulations)
Tacrolimus preparation not prescribed by brand  (brands vary in their dosing and pharmacokinetics)
Low molecular weight heparin omitted to be prescribed for prophylaxis (increased risk of thrombosis)
Opioid (regular) prescribed without concurrent use of laxatives (risk of severe constipation)
Anticonvulsant medication omitted for a patient with epilepsy (increased risk of seizures)
Parkinsonian medication omitted in a patient with Parkinsons disease (risk of exacerbation of symptoms of Parkinsons disease)
Prescribing of incorrect or inequivalent morphine (opiate) dose via multiple routes (risk of toxicity)
Potassium chloride infusion exceeding 40mmol/litre prescribed to be given via the peripheral route (increased risk of pain and phlebitis  at infusion site)
Doxycycline prescribed for a child under 12 years of age for cough, pyrexia and breathlessness
Levothyroxine prescribed as 100mg instead of 100 micrograms
Insulin prescribed as 60ml instead of 60 units
Digoxin prescribed as 250mg instead of 250 micrograms
Penicillin for a patient with penicillin allergy
Ramipril prescribed for a patient with documented allergy to lisinopril
Paracetamol prescribed regularly and when required.
Low molecular weight heparin prescribed at a prophylactic dose then prescribed at a therapeutic dose without discontinuing prophylactic dose
Ciprofloxacin IV 400mg twice a day prescribed concomitantly with Ciprofloxacin 500mg tablets twice a day
Penicillamine prescribed for a patient with an infection (instead of penicillin)
Amiloride prescribed for a patient instead of amlodipine
Prescribe oxygen
Prescribe subcutaneous fluids
Prescribe stat dose of doxycycline 200mg orally and then 100mg daily (regular)
Prescribe warfarin 5mg Mon - Friday and 4mg Sat and Sun
Prescribe digoxin loading dose
Prednisolone tapering course
Depot injections??
Prescribe Ceftriaxone 2g daily when required
Prescribe Dilzem (diltiazem) XL 120mg four times a day
Prescribe oxygen
Open a new patient record without closing previous patients.
Prescribe warfarin as a non-prescriber user
Prescribe from any of your antibiotic guidelines
Prescribe a drug in an unavailable form (e.g. prescribe morphine 50mg patch)
Prescribe Amlodipine 5.0mg daily
Modified release opioids prescribed generically
Insulin prescribed using incorrect units (e.g. levemir 0.02ml daily)
